client_certificate.description: Base64 encoded PKCS#12 certificate bundle to use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate

client_certificate_password.description: The password to decrypt the Client Certificate. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate

client_certificate_path.description: The path to the Client Certificate associated with the Service Principal for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate

client_id.description: The Client ID which should be used for service principal authentication

client_secret.description: The application password to use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Secret

disable_terraform_partner_id.description: Disable the Terraform Partner ID, which is used if a custom `partner_id` isn't specified

environment.description: The cloud environment which should be used. Possible values are: `global` (also `public`), `usgovernmentl4` (also `usgovernment`), `usgovernmentl5` (also `dod`), and `china`. Defaults to `global`

metadata_host.description: The Hostname which should be used for the Azure Metadata Service.

msi_endpoint.description: The path to a custom endpoint for Managed Identity - in most circumstances this should be detected automatically

oidc_request_token.description: The bearer token for the request to the OIDC provider. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_request_url.description: The URL for the OIDC provider from which to request an ID token. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_token.description: The ID token for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_token_file_path.description: The path to a file containing an ID token for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

partner_id.description: A GUID/UUID that is registered with Microsoft to facilitate partner resource usage attribution

tenant_id.description: The Tenant ID which should be used. Works with all authentication methods except Managed Identity

use_cli.description: Allow Azure CLI to be used for Authentication

use_msi.description: Allow Managed Identity to be used for Authentication

use_oidc.description: Allow OpenID Connect to be used for authentication

catalog_id.description: The ID of the Catalog this access package will be created in

description.description: The description of the access package

display_name.description: The display name of the access package

hidden.description: Whether the access package is hidden from the requestor

access_package_id.description: The ID of the access package that will contain the policy

display_name.description: The display name of the policy

duration_in_days.description: How many days this assignment is valid for

expiration_date.description: The date that this assignment expires, formatted as an RFC3339 date string in UTC (e.g. 2018-01-01T01:02:03Z)

extension_enabled.description: When enabled, users will be able to request extension of their access to this package before their access expires

approval_required_for_extension.description: Whether an approval is required to grant extension. Same approval settings used to approve initial access will apply

requestor_justification_required.description: Whether requestor are required to provide a justification to request an access package. Justification is visible to other approvers and the requestor

alternative_approval_enabled.description: If no action taken, forward to alternate approvers?

approval_timeout_in_days.description: Decision must be made in how many days? If a request is not approved within this time period after it is made, it will be automatically rejected

approver_justification_required.description: Whether an approver must provide a justification for their decision. Justification is visible to other approvers and the requestor

enable_alternative_approval_in_days.description: Forward to alternate approver(s) after how many days?

backup.description: For a user in an approval stage, this property indicates whether the user is a backup fallback approver

object_id.description: The object ID of the subject

block.description: If escalation is enabled and the primary approvers do not respond before the escalation time, the escalationApprovers are the users who will be asked to approve requests. This can be a collection of singleUser, groupMembers, requestorManager, internalSponsors and externalSponsors. When creating or updating a policy, if there are no escalation approvers, or escalation approvers are not required for the stage, the value of this property should be an empty collection

backup.description: For a user in an approval stage, this property indicates whether the user is a backup fallback approver

object_id.description: The object ID of the subject

block.description: The users who will be asked to approve requests. A collection of singleUser, groupMembers, requestorManager, internalSponsors and externalSponsors. When creating or updating a policy, include at least one userSet in this collection
The process to obtain an approval
Settings of whether approvals are required and how they are obtained

access_recommendation_enabled.description: Whether to show Show reviewer decision helpers. If enabled, system recommendations based on users' access information will be shown to the reviewers. The reviewer will be recommended to approve the review if the user has signed-in at least once during the last 30 days. The reviewer will be recommended to deny the review if the user has not signed-in during the last 30 days

access_review_timeout_behavior.description: What actions the system takes if reviewers don't respond in time

approver_justification_required.description: Whether a reviewer need provide a justification for their decision. Justification is visible to other reviewers and the requestor

duration_in_days.description: How many days each occurrence of the access review series will run

review_frequency.description: This will determine how often the access review campaign runs

starting_on.description: This is the date the access review campaign will start on, formatted as an RFC3339 date string in UTC(e.g. 2018-01-01T01:02:03Z), default is now. Once an access review has been created, you cannot update its start date

backup.description: For a user in an approval stage, this property indicates whether the user is a backup fallback approver

object_id.description: The object ID of the subject

block.description: If the reviewerType is Reviewers, this collection specifies the users who will be reviewers, either by ID or as members of a group, using a collection of singleUser and groupMembers
The settings of whether assignment review is needed and how it's conducted

sequence.description: The sequence number of this question

actual_value.description: The actual value of this choice

default_text.description: The default text of this question

content.description: The localized content of this question

language_code.description: The language code of this question content

block.description: The localized text of this question
The display text of this choice
Configuration of a choice to the question

default_text.description: The default text of this question

content.description: The localized content of this question

language_code.description: The language code of this question content

block.description: The localized text of this question
The content of this question
One or more questions to the requestor

requests_accepted.description: Whether to accept requests now, when disabled, no new requests can be made using this policy

scope_type.description: Specify the scopes of the requestors

backup.description: For a user in an approval stage, this property indicates whether the user is a backup fallback approver

object_id.description: The object ID of the subject

block.description: The users who are allowed to request on this policy, which can be singleUser, groupMembers, and connectedOrganizationMembers
This block configures the users who can request access

description.description: The description of the access package catalog

display_name.description: The display name of the access package catalog

externally_visible.description: Whether the access packages in this catalog can be requested by users outside the tenant

published.description: Whether the access packages in this catalog are available for management

catalog_id.description: The unique ID of the access package catalog.

principal_object_id.description: The object ID of the member principal

role_id.description: The object ID of the catalog role for this assignment

catalog_id.description: The unique ID of the access package catalog

resource_origin_id.description: The unique identifier of the resource in the origin system. In the case of an Azure AD group, this is the identifier of the group

resource_origin_system.description: The type of the resource in the origin system, such as SharePointOnline, AadApplication or AadGroup

access_package_id.description: The ID of access package this resource association is configured to

access_type.description: The role of access type to the specified resource, valid values are `Member` and `Owner`

catalog_resource_association_id.description: The ID of the access package catalog association

description.description: The description for the administrative unit

display_name.description: The display name for the administrative unit

hidden_membership_enabled.description: Whether the administrative unit and its members are hidden or publicly viewable in the directory

members.description: A set of object IDs of members who should be present in this administrative unit. Supported object types are Users or Groups

object_id.description: The object ID of the administrative unit

prevent_duplicate_names.description: If `true`, will return an error if an existing administrative unit is found with the same name

administrative_unit_object_id.description: The object ID of the administrative unit

member_object_id.description: The object ID of the member

administrative_unit_object_id.description: The object ID of the administrative unit

member_object_id.description: The object ID of the member

role_object_id.description: The object ID of the directory role

app_role_id.description: The ID of the app role to be assigned

principal_display_name.description: The display name of the principal to which the app role is assigned

principal_object_id.description: The object ID of the user, group or service principal to be assigned this app role

principal_type.description: The object type of the principal to which the app role is assigned

resource_display_name.description: The display name of the application representing the resource

resource_object_id.description: The object ID of the service principal representing the resource

app_role_ids.description: Mapping of app role names to UUIDs

application_id.description: The Application ID (also called Client ID)

description.description: Description of the application as shown to end users

device_only_auth_enabled.description: Specifies whether this application supports device authentication without a user.

disabled_by_microsoft.description: Whether Microsoft has disabled the registered application

display_name.description: The display name for the application

fallback_public_client_enabled.description: Specifies whether the application is a public client. Appropriate for apps using token grant flows that don't use a redirect URI

group_membership_claims.description: Configures the `groups` claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects

identifier_uris.description: The user-defined URI(s) that uniquely identify an application within its Azure AD tenant, or within a verified custom domain if the application is multi-tenant

logo_image.description: Base64 encoded logo image in gif, png or jpeg format

logo_url.description: CDN URL to the application's logo

marketing_url.description: URL of the application's marketing page

notes.description: User-specified notes relevant for the management of the application

oauth2_permission_scope_ids.description: Mapping of OAuth2.0 permission scope names to UUIDs

oauth2_post_response_required.description: Specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD allows POST requests, as opposed to GET requests.

object_id.description: The application's object ID

owners.description: A list of object IDs of principals that will be granted ownership of the application

prevent_duplicate_names.description: If `true`, will return an error if an existing application is found with the same name

privacy_statement_url.description: URL of the application's privacy statement

publisher_domain.description: The verified publisher domain for the application

service_management_reference.description: References application or service contact information from a Service or Asset Management database

sign_in_audience.description: The Microsoft account types that are supported for the current application

support_url.description: URL of the application's support page

tags.description: A set of tags to apply to the application

template_id.description: Unique ID of the application template from which this application is created

terms_of_service_url.description: URL of the application's terms of service statement

known_client_applications.description: Used for bundling consent if you have a solution that contains two parts: a client app and a custom web API app

mapped_claims_enabled.description: Allows an application to use claims mapping without specifying a custom signing key

requested_access_token_version.description: The access token version expected by this resource

admin_consent_description.description: Delegated permission description that appears in all tenant-wide admin consent experiences, intended to be read by an administrator granting the permission on behalf of all users

admin_consent_display_name.description: Display name for the delegated permission, intended to be read by an administrator granting the permission on behalf of all users

enabled.description: Determines if the permission scope is enabled

id.description: The unique identifier of the delegated permission

type.description: Whether this delegated permission should be considered safe for non-admin users to consent to on behalf of themselves, or whether an administrator should be required for consent to the permissions

user_consent_description.description: Delegated permission description that appears in the end user consent experience, intended to be read by a user consenting on their own behalf

user_consent_display_name.description: Display name for the delegated permission that appears in the end user consent experience

value.description: The value that is used for the `scp` claim in OAuth 2.0 access tokens

block.description: One or more `oauth2_permission_scope` blocks to describe delegated permissions exposed by the web API represented by this application

allowed_member_types.description: Specifies whether this app role definition can be assigned to users and groups by setting to `User`, or to other applications (that are accessing this application in a standalone scenario) by setting to `Application`, or to both

description.description: Description of the app role that appears when the role is being assigned and, if the role functions as an application permissions, during the consent experiences

display_name.description: Display name for the app role that appears during app role assignment and in consent experiences

enabled.description: Determines if the app role is enabled

id.description: The unique identifier of the app role

value.description: The value that is used for the `roles` claim in ID tokens and OAuth 2.0 access tokens that are authenticating an assigned service or user principal

custom_single_sign_on.description: Whether this application represents a custom SAML application for linked service principals

enterprise.description: Whether this application represents an Enterprise Application for linked service principals

gallery.description: Whether this application represents a gallery application for linked service principals

hide.description: Whether this application is invisible to users in My Apps and Office 365 Launcher

block.description: Block of features to configure for this application using tags

additional_properties.description: List of additional properties of the claim. If a property exists in this list, it modifies the behaviour of the optional claim

essential.description: Whether the claim specified by the client is necessary to ensure a smooth authorization experience

name.description: The name of the optional claim

source.description: The source of the claim. If `source` is absent, the claim is a predefined optional claim. If `source` is `user`, the value of `name` is the extension property from the user object

additional_properties.description: List of additional properties of the claim. If a property exists in this list, it modifies the behaviour of the optional claim

essential.description: Whether the claim specified by the client is necessary to ensure a smooth authorization experience

name.description: The name of the optional claim

source.description: The source of the claim. If `source` is absent, the claim is a predefined optional claim. If `source` is `user`, the value of `name` is the extension property from the user object

additional_properties.description: List of additional properties of the claim. If a property exists in this list, it modifies the behaviour of the optional claim

essential.description: Whether the claim specified by the client is necessary to ensure a smooth authorization experience

name.description: The name of the optional claim

source.description: The source of the claim. If `source` is absent, the claim is a predefined optional claim. If `source` is `user`, the value of `name` is the extension property from the user object

redirect_uris.description: The URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent
The URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent

homepage_url.description: Home page or landing page of the application

logout_url.description: The URL that will be used by Microsoft's authorization service to sign out a user using front-channel, back-channel or SAML logout protocols

redirect_uris.description: The URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent

access_token_issuance_enabled.description: Whether this web application can request an access token using OAuth 2.0 implicit flow

id_token_issuance_enabled.description: Whether this web application can request an ID token using OAuth 2.0 implicit flow

application_object_id.description: The object ID of the application for which this certificate should be created

encoding.description: Specifies the encoding used for the supplied certificate data

end_date.description: The end date until which the certificate is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). If omitted, the API will decide a suitable expiry date, which is typically around 2 years from the start date

end_date_relative.description: A relative duration for which the certificate is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`

key_id.description: A UUID used to uniquely identify this certificate. If omitted, a random UUID will be automatically generated

start_date.description: The start date from which the certificate is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). If this isn't specified, the current date and time are use

value.description: The certificate data, which can be PEM encoded, base64 encoded DER or hexadecimal encoded DER. See also the `encoding` argumen

application_object_id.description: The object ID of the application for which this federated identity credential should be created

audiences.description: List of audiences that can appear in the external token. This specifies what should be accepted in the `aud` claim of incoming tokens.

credential_id.description: A UUID used to uniquely identify this federated identity credential

description.description: A description for the federated identity credential

display_name.description: A unique display name for the federated identity credential

issuer.description: The URL of the external identity provider, which must match the issuer claim of the external token being exchanged. The combination of the values of issuer and subject must be unique on the app.

subject.description: The identifier of the external software workload within the external identity provider. The combination of issuer and subject must be unique on the app.

application_object_id.description: The object ID of the application for which this password should be created

display_name.description: A display name for the password

end_date.description: The end date until which the password is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`)

end_date_relative.description: A relative duration for which the password is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created

key_id.description: A UUID used to uniquely identify this password credential

rotate_when_changed.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger rotation of the password

start_date.description: The start date from which the password is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). If this isn't specified, the current date is used

value.description: The password for this application, which is generated by Azure Active Directory

application_object_id.description: The object ID of the application to which this pre-authorized application should be added

authorized_app_id.description: The application ID of the pre-authorized application

permission_ids.description: The IDs of the permission scopes required by the pre-authorized application

definition.description: A string collection containing a JSON string that defines the rules and settings for this policy

display_name.description: Display name for this policy

description.description: The description of the custom directory role

display_name.description: The display name of the custom directory role

enabled.description: Indicates whether the role is enabled for assignment

object_id.description: The object ID of the directory role

template_id.description: Custom template identifier that is typically used if one needs an identifier to be the same across different directories.

version.description: The version of the role definition.

allowed_resource_actions.description: Set of tasks that can be performed on a resource

block.description: List of permissions that are included in the custom directory role

description.description: The description of the directory role

display_name.description: The display name of the directory role

object_id.description: The object ID of the directory role

template_id.description: The object ID of the template associated with the directory role

app_scope_id.description: Identifier of the app-specific scope when the assignment scope is app-specific

app_scope_object_id.description: Identifier of the app-specific scope when the assignment scope is app-specific

directory_scope_id.description: Identifier of the directory object representing the scope of the assignment

directory_scope_object_id.description: Identifier of the directory object representing the scope of the assignment

principal_object_id.description: The object ID of the member principal

role_id.description: The object ID of the directory role for this assignment

member_object_id.description: The object ID of the member

role_object_id.description: The object ID of the directory role

administrative_unit_ids.description: The administrative unit IDs in which the group should be. If empty, the group will be created at the tenant level.

assignable_to_role.description: Indicates whether this group can be assigned to an Azure Active Directory role. This property can only be `true` for security-enabled groups.

auto_subscribe_new_members.description: Indicates whether new members added to the group will be auto-subscribed to receive email notifications.

behaviors.description: The group behaviours for a Microsoft 365 group

display_name.description: The display name for the group

external_senders_allowed.description: Indicates whether people external to the organization can send messages to the group.

hide_from_address_lists.description: Indicates whether the group is displayed in certain parts of the Outlook user interface: in the Address Book, in address lists for selecting message recipients, and in the Browse Groups dialog for searching groups.

hide_from_outlook_clients.description: Indicates whether the group is displayed in Outlook clients, such as Outlook for Windows and Outlook on the web.

mail.description: The SMTP address for the group

mail_enabled.description: Whether the group is a mail enabled, with a shared group mailbox. At least one of `mail_enabled` or `security_enabled` must be specified. A group can be mail enabled _and_ security enabled

mail_nickname.description: The mail alias for the group, unique in the organisation

members.description: A set of members who should be present in this group. Supported object types are Users, Groups or Service Principals

object_id.description: The object ID of the group

onpremises_domain_name.description: The on-premises FQDN, also called dnsDomainName, synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_group_type.description: Indicates the target on-premise group type the group will be written back as

onpremises_netbios_name.description: The on-premises NetBIOS name, synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_sam_account_name.description: The on-premises SAM account name, synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_security_identifier.description: The on-premises security identifier (SID), synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_sync_enabled.description: Whether this group is synchronized from an on-premises directory (true), no longer synchronized (false), or has never been synchronized (null)

owners.description: A set of owners who own this group. Supported object types are Users or Service Principals

preferred_language.description: The preferred language for a Microsoft 365 group, in ISO 639-1 notation

prevent_duplicate_names.description: If `true`, will return an error if an existing group is found with the same name

provisioning_options.description: The group provisioning options for a Microsoft 365 group

proxy_addresses.description: Email addresses for the group that direct to the same group mailbox

security_enabled.description: Whether the group is a security group for controlling access to in-app resources. At least one of `security_enabled` or `mail_enabled` must be specified. A group can be security enabled _and_ mail enabled

theme.description: The colour theme for a Microsoft 365 group

types.description: A set of group types to configure for the group. `Unified` specifies a Microsoft 365 group. Required when `mail_enabled` is true

visibility.description: Specifies the group join policy and group content visibility

writeback_enabled.description: Whether this group should be synced from Azure AD to the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

rule.description: Rule to determine members for a dynamic group. Required when `group_types` contains 'DynamicMembership'

block.description: An optional block to configure dynamic membership for the group. Cannot be used with `members`

group_object_id.description: The object ID of the group you want to add the member to

member_object_id.description: The object ID of the principal you want to add as a member to the group. Supported object types are Users, Groups or Service Principals

redeem_url.description: The URL the user can use to redeem their invitation

redirect_url.description: The URL that the user should be redirected to once the invitation is redeemed

user_display_name.description: The display name of the user being invited

user_email_address.description: The email address of the user being invited

user_id.description: Object ID of the invited user

user_type.description: The user type of the user being invited

additional_recipients.description: Email addresses of additional recipients the invitation message should be sent to

body.description: Customized message body you want to send if you don't want to send the default message

language.description: The language you want to send the default message in

block.description: Customize the message sent to the invited user

account_enabled.description: Whether or not the service principal account is enabled

alternative_names.description: A list of alternative names, used to retrieve service principals by subscription, identify resource group and full resource ids for managed identities

app_role_assignment_required.description: Whether this service principal requires an app role assignment to a user or group before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application

app_role_ids.description: Mapping of app role names to UUIDs

application_id.description: The application ID (client ID) of the application for which to create a service principal

application_tenant_id.description: The tenant ID where the associated application is registered

description.description: Description of the service principal provided for internal end-users

display_name.description: The display name of the application associated with this service principal

homepage_url.description: Home page or landing page of the application

login_url.description: The URL where the service provider redirects the user to Azure AD to authenticate. Azure AD uses the URL to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Azure AD My Apps. When blank, Azure AD performs IdP-initiated sign-on for applications configured with SAML-based single sign-on

logout_url.description: The URL that will be used by Microsoft's authorization service to sign out a user using front-channel, back-channel or SAML logout protocols

notes.description: Free text field to capture information about the service principal, typically used for operational purposes

notification_email_addresses.description: List of email addresses where Azure AD sends a notification when the active certificate is near the expiration date. This is only for the certificates used to sign the SAML token issued for Azure AD Gallery applications

oauth2_permission_scope_ids.description: Mapping of OAuth2.0 permission scope names to UUIDs

object_id.description: The object ID of the service principal

owners.description: A list of object IDs of principals that will be granted ownership of the service principal

preferred_single_sign_on_mode.description: The single sign-on mode configured for this application. Azure AD uses the preferred single sign-on mode to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Azure AD My Apps

redirect_uris.description: The URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in with the associated application, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent for the associated application

saml_metadata_url.description: The URL where the service exposes SAML metadata for federation

service_principal_names.description: A list of identifier URI(s), copied over from the associated application

sign_in_audience.description: The Microsoft account types that are supported for the associated application

tags.description: A set of tags to apply to the service principal

type.description: Identifies whether the service principal represents an application or a managed identity

use_existing.description: When true, the resource will return an existing service principal instead of failing with an error

custom_single_sign_on.description: Whether this service principal represents a custom SAML application

enterprise.description: Whether this service principal represents an Enterprise Application

gallery.description: Whether this service principal represents a gallery application

hide.description: Whether this app is invisible to users in My Apps and Office 365 Launcher

block.description: Block of features to configure for this service principal using tags

custom_single_sign_on_app.description: Whether this service principal represents a custom SAML application

enterprise_application.description: Whether this service principal represents an Enterprise Application

gallery_application.description: Whether this service principal represents a gallery application

visible_to_users.description: Whether this app is visible to users in My Apps and Office 365 Launcher

block.description: Block of features to configure for this service principal using tags

relay_state.description: The relative URI the service provider would redirect to after completion of the single sign-on flow

block.description: Settings related to SAML single sign-on

encoding.description: Specifies the encoding used for the supplied certificate data

end_date.description: The end date until which the certificate is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`)

end_date_relative.description: A relative duration for which the certificate is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`. Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "µs"), "ms", "s", "m", "h"

key_id.description: A UUID used to uniquely identify this certificate. If not specified a UUID will be automatically generated

service_principal_id.description: The object ID of the service principal for which this certificate should be created

start_date.description: The start date from which the certificate is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). If this isn't specified, the current date is used

value.description: The certificate data, which can be PEM encoded, base64 encoded DER or hexadecimal encoded DER

claims_mapping_policy_id.description: ID of the claims mapping policy to assign

service_principal_id.description: Object ID of the service principal for which to assign the policy

claim_values.description: A set of claim values for delegated permission scopes which should be included in access tokens for the resource

resource_service_principal_object_id.description: The object ID of the service principal representing the resource to be accessed

service_principal_object_id.description: The object ID of the service principal for which this delegated permission grant should be created

user_object_id.description: The object ID of the user on behalf of whom the service principal is authorized to access the resource

display_name.description: A display name for the password

end_date.description: The end date until which the password is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`)

end_date_relative.description: A relative duration for which the password is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created

key_id.description: A UUID used to uniquely identify this password credential

rotate_when_changed.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger rotation of the password

service_principal_id.description: The object ID of the service principal for which this password should be created

start_date.description: The start date from which the password is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). If this isn't specified, the current date is used

value.description: The password for this service principal, which is generated by Azure Active Directory

display_name.description: A friendly name for the certificate

end_date.description: The end date until which the certificate is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). Default is 3 years from current date.

key_id.description: A UUID used to uniquely identify the verify certificate.

service_principal_id.description: The object ID of the service principal for which this certificate should be created

start_date.description: The start date from which the certificate is valid, formatted as an RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`).

value.description: The certificate data, which is PEM encoded but does not include the header/footer

enabled.description: Whether or not the synchronization job is enabled

service_principal_id.description: The object ID of the service principal for which this synchronization job should be created

template_id.description: Identifier of the synchronization template this job is based on.

service_principal_id.description: The object ID of the service principal for which this synchronization secret should be created

about_me.description: A freeform field for the user to describe themselves

account_enabled.description: Whether or not the account should be enabled

age_group.description: The age group of the user

business_phones.description: The telephone numbers for the user. Only one number can be set for this property. Read-only for users synced with Azure AD Connect

city.description: The city in which the user is located

company_name.description: The company name which the user is associated. This property can be useful for describing the company that an external user comes from

consent_provided_for_minor.description: Whether consent has been obtained for minors

cost_center.description: The cost center associated with the user.

country.description: The country/region in which the user is located, e.g. `US` or `UK`

creation_type.description: Indicates whether the user account was created as a regular school or work account (`null`), an external account (`Invitation`), a local account for an Azure Active Directory B2C tenant (`LocalAccount`) or self-service sign-up using email verification (`EmailVerified`)

department.description: The name for the department in which the user works

disable_password_expiration.description: Whether the users password is exempt from expiring

disable_strong_password.description: Whether the user is allowed weaker passwords than the default policy to be specified.

display_name.description: The name to display in the address book for the user

division.description: The name of the division in which the user works.

employee_id.description: The employee identifier assigned to the user by the organisation

employee_type.description: Captures enterprise worker type. For example, Employee, Contractor, Consultant, or Vendor.

external_user_state.description: For an external user invited to the tenant, this property represents the invited user's invitation status

fax_number.description: The fax number of the user

force_password_change.description: Whether the user is forced to change the password during the next sign-in. Only takes effect when also changing the password

given_name.description: The given name (first name) of the user

im_addresses.description: The instant message voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) addresses for the user

mail.description: The SMTP address for the user. Cannot be unset.

mail_nickname.description: The mail alias for the user. Defaults to the user name part of the user principal name (UPN)

manager_id.description: The object ID of the user's manager

mobile_phone.description: The primary cellular telephone number for the user

object_id.description: The object ID of the user

office_location.description: The office location in the user's place of business

onpremises_distinguished_name.description: The on-premise Active Directory distinguished name (DN) of the user

onpremises_domain_name.description: The on-premise FQDN (i.e. dnsDomainName) of the user

onpremises_immutable_id.description: The value used to associate an on-premise Active Directory user account with their Azure AD user object. This must be specified if you are using a federated domain for the user's `user_principal_name` property when creating a new user account

onpremises_sam_account_name.description: The on-premise SAM account name of the user

onpremises_security_identifier.description: The on-premise security identifier (SID) of the user

onpremises_sync_enabled.description: Whether this user is synchronized from an on-premises directory (true), no longer synchronized (false), or has never been synchronized (null)

onpremises_user_principal_name.description: The on-premise user principal name of the user

other_mails.description: Additional email addresses for the user

password.description: The password for the user. The password must satisfy minimum requirements as specified by the password policy. The maximum length is 256 characters. This property is required when creating a new user

postal_code.description: The postal code for the user's postal address. The postal code is specific to the user's country/region. In the United States of America, this attribute contains the ZIP code

preferred_language.description: The user's preferred language, in ISO 639-1 notation

proxy_addresses.description: Email addresses for the user that direct to the same mailbox

show_in_address_list.description: Whether or not the Outlook global address list should include this user

state.description: The state or province in the user's address

street_address.description: The street address of the user's place of business

surname.description: The user's surname (family name or last name)

usage_location.description: The usage location of the user. Required for users that will be assigned licenses due to legal requirement to check for availability of services in countries. The usage location is a two letter country code (ISO standard 3166). Examples include: `NO`, `JP`, and `GB`. Cannot be reset to null once set

user_principal_name.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user

user_type.description: The user type in the directory. Possible values are `Guest` or `Member`

attribute_type.description: The type of the user flow attribute

data_type.description: The data type of the user flow attribute

description.description: The description of the user flow attribute that is shown to the user at the time of sign-up

display_name.description: The display name of the user flow attribute.

catalog_id.description: The ID of the Catalog this access package is in

description.description: The description of the access package

display_name.description: The display name of the access package

hidden.description: Whether the access package is hidden from the requestor

object_id.description: The ID of this access package

description.description: The description of the access package catalog

display_name.description: The display name of the access package catalog

externally_visible.description: Whether the access packages in this catalog can be requested by users outside the tenant

object_id.description: The ID of this access package catalog

published.description: Whether the access packages in this catalog are available for management

description.description: The description of the catalog role

display_name.description: The display name of the catalog role

object_id.description: The object ID of the catalog role

template_id.description: The object ID of the template associated with the catalog role

description.description: The description for the administrative unit

display_name.description: The display name for the administrative unit

members.description: A list of object IDs of members who are be present in this administrative unit.

object_id.description: The object ID of the administrative unit

visibility.description: Whether the administrative unit and its members are hidden or publicly viewable in the directory

app_role_ids.description: Mapping of app role names to UUIDs

app_roles.description: List of app roles published by the application

application_id.description: The Application ID (also called Client ID)

description.description: Description of the application as shown to end users

device_only_auth_enabled.description: Specifies whether this application supports device authentication without a user.

disabled_by_microsoft.description: Whether Microsoft has disabled the registered application

display_name.description: The display name for the application

fallback_public_client_enabled.description: The fallback application type as public client, such as an installed application running on a mobile device

feature_tags.description: Block of features configured for this application using tags

group_membership_claims.description: The `groups` claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects

identifier_uris.description: A list of user-defined URI(s) that uniquely identify a Web application within it's Azure AD tenant, or within a verified custom domain if the application is multi-tenant

logo_url.description: CDN URL to the application's logo

marketing_url.description: URL of the application's marketing page

notes.description: User-specified notes relevant for the management of the application

oauth2_permission_scope_ids.description: Mapping of OAuth2.0 permission scope names to UUIDs

oauth2_post_response_required.description: Specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD allows POST requests, as opposed to GET requests.

object_id.description: The application's object ID

owners.description: A list of object IDs of principals that are assigned ownership of the application

privacy_statement_url.description: URL of the application's privacy statement

publisher_domain.description: The verified publisher domain for the application

service_management_reference.description: References application or service contact information from a Service or Asset Management database

sign_in_audience.description: The Microsoft account types that are supported for the current application

support_url.description: URL of the application's support page

tags.description: A set of tags applied to the application

terms_of_service_url.description: URL of the application's terms of service statement

result.description: A mapping of application names and application IDs

categories.description: List of categories for this templated application

display_name.description: The display name for the application template

homepage_url.description: Home page URL of the templated application

logo_url.description: URL to retrieve the logo for this templated application

publisher.description: Name of the publisher for this templated application

supported_provisioning_types.description: The provisioning modes supported by this templated application

supported_single_sign_on_modes.description: The single sign on modes supported by this templated application

client_id.description: The client ID (application ID) linked to the authenticated principal, or the application used for delegated authentication

object_id.description: The object ID of the authenticated principal

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the authenticated principal

object_id.description: The object ID of the principal

type.description: The OData type of the principal

object_ids.description: The object IDs of the roles

template_ids.description: The template IDs of the roles

admin_managed.description: Set to `true` to only return domains whose DNS is managed by Microsoft 365

include_unverified.description: Set to `true` if unverified Azure AD domains should be included

only_default.description: Set to `true` to only return the default domain

only_initial.description: Set to `true` to only return the initial domain, which is your primary Azure Active Directory tenant domain

only_root.description: Set to `true` to only return verified root domains. Excludes subdomains and unverified domains

supports_services.description: A list of supported services that must be supported by a domain

assignable_to_role.description: Indicates whether this group can be assigned to an Azure Active Directory role

auto_subscribe_new_members.description: Indicates whether new members added to the group will be auto-subscribed to receive email notifications.

behaviors.description: The group behaviors for a Microsoft 365 group

description.description: The optional description of the group

display_name.description: The display name for the group

dynamic_membership.description: An optional block to configure dynamic membership for the group. Cannot be used with `members`

external_senders_allowed.description: Indicates whether people external to the organization can send messages to the group.

hide_from_address_lists.description: Indicates whether the group is displayed in certain parts of the Outlook user interface: in the Address Book, in address lists for selecting message recipients, and in the Browse Groups dialog for searching groups.

hide_from_outlook_clients.description: Indicates whether the group is displayed in Outlook clients, such as Outlook for Windows and Outlook on the web.

mail.description: The SMTP address for the group

mail_nickname.description: The mail alias for the group, unique in the organisation

members.description: The object IDs of the group members

object_id.description: The object ID of the group

onpremises_domain_name.description: The on-premises FQDN, also called dnsDomainName, synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_group_type.description: Indicates the target on-premise group type the group will be written back as

onpremises_netbios_name.description: The on-premises NetBIOS name, synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_sam_account_name.description: The on-premises SAM account name, synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_security_identifier.description: The on-premises security identifier (SID), synchronized from the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

onpremises_sync_enabled.description: Whether this group is synchronized from an on-premises directory (true), no longer synchronized (false), or has never been synchronized (null)

owners.description: The object IDs of the group owners

preferred_language.description: The preferred language for a Microsoft 365 group, in ISO 639-1 notation

provisioning_options.description: The group provisioning options for a Microsoft 365 group

proxy_addresses.description: Email addresses for the group that direct to the same group mailbox

security_enabled.description: Whether the group is a security group

theme.description: The colour theme for a Microsoft 365 group

types.description: A list of group types configured for the group. The only supported type is `Unified`, which specifies a Microsoft 365 group

visibility.description: Specifies the group join policy and group content visibility

writeback_enabled.description: Whether this group is synced from Azure AD to the on-premises directory when Azure AD Connect is used

display_name_prefix.description: Common display name prefix of the groups

display_names.description: The display names of the groups

ignore_missing.description: Ignore missing groups and return groups that were found. The data source will still fail if no groups are found

object_ids.description: The object IDs of the groups

return_all.description: Retrieve all groups with no filter

account_enabled.description: Whether or not the service principal account is enabled

alternative_names.description: A list of alternative names, used to retrieve service principals by subscription, identify resource group and full resource ids for managed identities

app_role_assignment_required.description: Whether this service principal requires an app role assignment to a user or group before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application

app_role_ids.description: Mapping of app role names to UUIDs

application_id.description: The application ID (client ID) of the application associated with this service principal

application_tenant_id.description: The tenant ID where the associated application is registered

description.description: Description of the service principal provided for internal end-users

display_name.description: The display name of the application associated with this service principal

feature_tags.description: Block of features configured for this service principal using tags

features.description: Block of features configured for this service principal using tags

homepage_url.description: Home page or landing page of the application

login_url.description: The URL where the service provider redirects the user to Azure AD to authenticate. Azure AD uses the URL to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Azure AD My Apps

logout_url.description: The URL that will be used by Microsoft's authorization service to sign out a user using front-channel, back-channel or SAML logout protocols

notes.description: Free text field to capture information about the service principal, typically used for operational purposes

notification_email_addresses.description: List of email addresses where Azure AD sends a notification when the active certificate is near the expiration date. This is only for the certificates used to sign the SAML token issued for Azure AD Gallery applications

oauth2_permission_scope_ids.description: Mapping of OAuth2.0 permission scope names to UUIDs

object_id.description: The object ID of the service principal

preferred_single_sign_on_mode.description: The single sign-on mode configured for this application. Azure AD uses the preferred single sign-on mode to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Azure AD My Apps

redirect_uris.description: The URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in with the associated application, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent for the associated application

saml_metadata_url.description: The URL where the service exposes SAML metadata for federation

saml_single_sign_on.description: Settings related to SAML single sign-on

service_principal_names.description: A list of identifier URI(s), copied over from the associated application

sign_in_audience.description: The Microsoft account types that are supported for the associated application

tags.description: A set of tags to apply to the service principal

type.description: Identifies whether the service principal represents an application or a managed identity

application_ids.description: The application IDs (client IDs) of the applications associated with the service principals

display_names.description: The display names of the applications associated with the service principals

ignore_missing.description: Ignore missing service principals and return the service principals that were found. The data source will still fail if no service principals are found

object_ids.description: The object IDs of the service principals

return_all.description: Fetch all service principals with no filter and return all that were found. The data source will still fail if no service principals are found.
